Misconfigurations.Title: Athena databases and workgroup configurations are created unencrypted at rest by default, they should be encrypted
Misconfigurations.Description: Athena databases and workspace result sets should be encrypted at rests. These databases and query sets are generally derived from data in S3 buckets and should have the same level of at rest protection.
Misconfigurations.Message: Workgroup does not have encryption configured.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption at rest for Athena databases and workgroup configurations

Misconfigurations.Title: Athena workgroups should enforce configuration to prevent client disabling encryption
Misconfigurations.Description: Athena workgroup configuration should be enforced to prevent client side changes to disable encryption settings.
Misconfigurations.Message: The workgroup configuration is not enforced.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enforce the configuration to prevent client overrides

Misconfigurations.Title: Cloudfront distribution should have Access Logging configured
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure CloudFront Access Logging to create log files that contain detailed information about every user request that CloudFront receives
Misconfigurations.Message: Distribution does not have logging enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable logging for CloudFront distributions

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudFront distribution does not have a WAF in front.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure a Web Application Firewall in front of your CloudFront distribution. This will mitigate many types of attacks on your web application.
Misconfigurations.Message: Distribution does not utilise a WAF.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable WAF for the CloudFront distribution

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudFront distribution allows unencrypted (HTTP) communications.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Plain HTTP is unencrypted and human-readable. This means that if a malicious actor was to eavesdrop on your connection, they would be able to see all of your data flowing back and forth.

You should use HTTPS, which is HTTP over an encrypted (TLS) connection, meaning eavesdroppers cannot read your traffic.
Misconfigurations.Message: Distribution allows unencrypted communications.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Only allow HTTPS for CloudFront distribution communication

Misconfigurations.Title: An Network ACL rule allows ALL ports.
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensure access to specific required ports is allowed, and nothing else.
Misconfigurations.Message: Network ACL rule allows access using ALL ports.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set specific allowed ports

Misconfigurations.Title: An Network ACL rule allows ALL ports.
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensure access to specific required ports is allowed, and nothing else.
Misconfigurations.Message: Network ACL rule allows access using ALL ports.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set specific allowed ports

Misconfigurations.Title: An ingress Network ACL rule allows specific ports from /0.
Misconfigurations.Description: Opening up ACLs to the public internet is potentially dangerous. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that explicitly require it where possible.
Misconfigurations.Message: Network ACL rule allows ingress from public internet.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: An egress security group rule allows traffic to /0.
Misconfigurations.Description: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows egress to multiple public internet addresses.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Misconfigurations.Title: An ingress security group rule allows traffic from /0.
Misconfigurations.Description: Opening up ports to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that explicitly require it where possible.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows ingress from public internet.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Misconfigurations.Title: AWS best practice to not use the default VPC for workflows
Misconfigurations.Description: Default VPC does not have a lot of the critical security features that standard VPC comes with, new resources should not be created in the default VPC and it should not be present in the Terraform.
Misconfigurations.Message: Default VPC is used.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a non-default vpc for resources to be created in

Misconfigurations.Title: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
Misconfigurations.Description: VPC Flow Logs provide visibility into network traffic that traverses the VPC and can be used to detect anomalous traffic or insight during security workflows.
Misconfigurations.Message: VPC Flow Logs is not enabled for VPC vpc-0ba8c20b3c4b9fcdb
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable flow logs for VPC

Misconfigurations.Title: IAM groups should have MFA enforcement activated.
Misconfigurations.Description: IAM groups should be protected with multi factor authentication to add safe guards to password compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Multi-Factor authentication is not enforced for group
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use terraform-module/enforce-mfa/aws to ensure that MFA is enforced

Misconfigurations.Title: IAM policies should not be granted directly to users.
Misconfigurations.Description: CIS recommends that you apply IAM policies directly to groups and roles but not users. Assigning privileges at the group or role level reduces the complexity of access management as the number of users grow. Reducing access management complexity might in turn reduce opportunity for a principal to inadvertently receive or retain excessive privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: One or more policies are attached directly to a user
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Grant policies at the group level instead.

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should block public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By blocking, PUTs with fail if the object has any public ACL a.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable blocking any PUT calls with a public ACL specified

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public policy
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 bucket policy should have block public policy to prevent users from putting a policy that enable public access.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public policies
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Prevent policies that allow public access being PUT

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket. 
You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets. 
With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
Misconfigurations.Description: Encryption using AWS keys provides protection for your S3 buckets. To increase control of the encryption and manage factors like rotation use customer managed keys.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not encrypt data with a customer managed key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption using customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public Acl
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not ignore public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Bucket Logging
Misconfigurations.Description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has logging disabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging
